Line 63: Line 63:      
===Modern ethics===
 
===Modern ethics===
−
Modern ethics is the philosiphy behind the ways that people should behave. There are many branches of ethics including buisness,political and so on. In the [[modern philosophy|modern]] era, ethical theories were generally divided between the consequentialist theories of utilitarian philosophers such as [[Jeremy Bentham]] and [[John Stuart Mill]], and [[deontological ethics]] as epitomized by the work of [[Immanuel Kant]]. This is also the era associated with the origin of [[pragmatic ethics]], especially in the work of [[John Dewey]].
+
In the [[modern philosophy|modern]] era, ethical theories were generally divided between the consequentialist theories of utilitarian philosophers such as [[Jeremy Bentham]] and [[John Stuart Mill]], and [[deontological ethics]] as epitomized by the work of [[Immanuel Kant]]. This is also the era associated with the origin of [[pragmatic ethics]], especially in the work of [[John Dewey]].

====Modern consequentialism====
